home.title: Praga Caput Regni Solo Helper
home.play1: Play against Peter Parler, the Solo Mode opponent of Praga Caput Regni.
home.play2: This helper application replaces the card deck and provides help inside the app. It's possible to play against the Parler family (up to three bots).
home.play3: Peter Parler does not gain points, but simulates other players. Beat your own score!
home.peterParler1: Peter Parler, known as Petr Parléř in Czech, was a Czech-German mason who lived during the reign of Charles IV and his sons. He was born in Germany sometime around 1333 and died in 1399 in Prague.
home.peterParler2: Parler worked on the most famous architectural structures of this era, including St. Vitus Cathedral, Charles Bridge, various civic buildings in Prague's Old Town, and St. Barbara's Church in Kutná Hora.

board.title: Board Setup
board.setupForPlayers: Setup the game following the rules for {playerCount} players
board.productionTokenSet: Use only this set of production tokens:
board.botPawnPlaza: Place the pawn figure in Peter Parlers color on a plaza of your choice. This is where Peter Parler is planning to build. | For each Parler Bot, place the pawn in its color on a (different) plaza of your choice. This is where the bots are planning to build.
board.noOtherComponents: Parler does not need a player board or other components.

takeUpgradeTile.title: Take Upgrade Tile
takeUpgradeTile.info1: Take the {ordinal} upgrade tile and return it to the bottom of its stock.
takeUpgradeTile.info2: Replace it with a new tile.

takeWallTile.title: Take Wall Tile
takeWallTile.info1: Take the {ordinal} wall tile and return it to the bottom of its stock.
takeWallTile.info2: Replace it with a new tile.

constructBuilding.title: Construct Building
constructBuilding.info1: Take the {ordinal} building tile and place it on the main board adjacent to the plaza marked with the pawn.
constructBuilding.info2: If the tile has a blue corner, you must place it so that it matches up with a blue corner, if possible. Otherwise, you may place it however you wish.
constructBuilding.info3: Give the new building one of Parler’s cubes, if it has a space for one.
constructBuilding.info4: If the building is the last that can be built at that plaza, you immediately get zero, one, or both plaza bonuses, according to the usual rules. Parler’s cubes compete against yours, although he does not gain any plaza rewards himself.
constructBuilding.info5: Move the pawn figure clockwise around the board, as shown in the example below. The number of spaces to move is determined by the cost printed on the building tile. Add the resource costs together. For example, a cost of [-2 gold] [-2 stone] moves the figure 4 spaces.
constructBuilding.info6: If the figure lands on a plaza that has already been evaluated, keep advancing it clockwise until it lands on a plaza that still has room for a new building. Similarly, on your turn, if you build the last possible building on the marked plaza, advance the figure to the next plaza that Parler can still build on.

actionTileSelection.title: Recycle Action Tile
actionTileSelection.info: Take the {ordinal} action tile on the wheel, rotate the wheel one space clockwise and place the tile in the empty space at the beginning of the red zone.
